title: Five Branded Women
text:
Five Branded Women is a 1960 <a href="Cinema%20of%20Italy">Italian</a>-American <a href="international%20co-production">international co-production</a> film directed by <a href="Martin%20Ritt">Martin Ritt</a> (his only war film) and produced by <a href="Dino%20De%20Laurentiis">Dino De Laurentiis</a>. It features an international cast including <a href="Silvana%20Mangano">Silvana Mangano</a>, <a href="Barbara%20Bel%20Geddes">Barbara Bel Geddes</a>, <a href="Jeanne%20Moreau">Jeanne Moreau</a> and <a href="Vera%20Miles">Vera Miles</a>. The film is set during the <a href="Nazi%20Germany">Nazi</a> occupation of <a href="Yugoslavia">Yugoslavia</a> and was shot in <a href="Italy">Italy</a> and <a href="Klagenfurt">Klagenfurt</a>, <a href="Austria">Austria</a>.`
Plot.
Five Yugoslavian women are accused of consorting with the Nazis who have taken over their town. The women are banished from the town and meet up with guerillas in the mountains.
